title: Familiar Scenery
opening: In honor of the saints whose births or deaths took place under this moon, the people perform music once beloved by those divine beings. Whether by harp, by flute, or voice alone, joyous melodies are shared between farmers as they sew their seeds across the vast plains of Tailtean and Gronder.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: So, you have safely disposed of those bandits. I pray that their souls find salvation. But why did they target the students to begin with? We must further investigate the true cause of all that took place. Until we know more, I ask that you support the students and relieve them of any unnecessary worry.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I will do all that I can.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Good. I have high expectations for you. By the way, how was your time in Zanado? Legend has it, in ancient times, a goddess alighted upon this world in that very canyon. For a goddess from heavens, Zanado could only have been a temporary haven.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Long ago, the divine Seiros received a revelation from the goddess. A gift, to help the lost. The goddess is always watching over Fódlan from her kingdom above. However, in ancient times, the goddess graced this world with her presence and offered salvation to the people here. She is the mother of all life, the arbiter of every soul.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I see. During your time here, I pray that you come to devote yourself to the teachings of Seiros.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Uh...Lady Rhea, I am sorry to interrupt. There is something I must ask about in regard to those bandits...

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: As you wish. We shall continue our discussion when next we meet.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: A goddess... I have no memory of her. But then... I have no memory at all! Oh, how bothersome! It is as though I know...and yet I don't. Perhaps Zanado was my home back when the goddess walked the land. If so... What does that make me now? A ghost?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Are you simple?! That's impossible! I am most certainly alive.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Hmm... No. That cannot be. I am most certainly alive.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Of course, we also have the mystery of why I'm here with you. Is it somehow connected? Perhaps some past regret is stopping me from moving on, and now I'm forced to stay with you instead... No, that's not it! I can't believe in such a meaningless existence! I... I...

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: For some students, this will be their first time stepping onto a real battlefield. It's important that they're mentally prepared. As for me? Ha! Do I look green to you? Is there anything you wish to ask me about, regarding spending your time at the monastery or battles?

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Just as students have much to learn from other students, professors can also share their knowledge with each other. You should consider seeking instruction from Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela. I think you'll find their insight quite interesting.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Which house a student is assigned to depends on where they're from. That said, each professor has their own area of expertise. So if a student is adamant about it, it is possible to switch someone from one house to another. Pending your approval, of course. If you become closer with the students by partaking in the various activities around the monastery, you'll be able to talk to them about such things.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: You're quite powerful to have beaten us in the mock battle. Such a shame you aren't leading our class...

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: We have only just arrived at the academy, and we're already being sent out to take care of bandits. It is a noble mission, but one that will likely require battle. In practice, there is little difference between a battle and a war. Even with the support of the Knights of Seiros, we must still brace ourselves for the challenge. Do you have any other questions about life at the monastery or about battle?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Just as students receive guidance from professors, professors may also guide each other. If you're interested, you should seek out Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: A student's house is determined by their place of origin, but naturally, each individual has their own aptitudes and interests. That said, if a student so desires and their current professor consents, they may transfer from one house to another. If you get to know the students better through the activities at the monastery, they may approach you about this.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Your performance in the mock battle was exceptional, Professor. You have inspired me to follow your example and study even more diligently. Perhaps we could train together sometime. I would love to test myself against your sword skills again.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Those bandits really didn't think things through, did they? They had to have known the knights would be after them the moment they entered the monastery's turf. Fine by me, though. I'm raring for some real combat experience. Any chance to grow is a good thing. Is there anything else you want to ask me, Teach? About living at the monastery or combat, anything like that?

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Students aren't the only ones who have something to learn from their professors. Professors can also learn from each other. If you want to, you should try trading knowledge with Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: The house a student belongs to is determined by where they're from, but it is possible for someone to switch to a different one. Of course, that's only if the student very strongly wants to make the change and their professor is on board with it. If you do a lot of different activities around the monastery, you'll get closer to students and they may ask you about it.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: I hear you've been tasked with hunting down bandits, right? Meanwhile, my class is stuck with a downright peaceful mission. Sounds like you'll be fighting alongside the knights too. Don't let the monastery down, Teach.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: I fully accept the necessity of real battle from time to time, but it is still a surprise to be tasked with punishing bandits without warning. It is a rather different sort of mission. It makes me wonder what the archbishop is planning...

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: I've heard your class is hunting thieves. That mission is very different from the one we were given.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Do you know of the Aegir family? We have long held the position of prime minister in the Empire. The Empire's power lies with six noble families, my family foremost among them. The full explanation may be time-consuming. I can give you a moment to get ready, if you would like to take notes.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not taking notes.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm ready.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: All right. I will list the six great noble families. There's Caspar's father, Count Bergliez, the Minister of Military Affairs. Then there's Linhardt's father, Count Hevring, the Minister of Domestic Affairs. Beradetta's father, Count Varley, is the Minister of Religious Affairs. Hubert's father, Marquis Vestra, is the Minister of the Imperial Household. Finally we have Duke Gerth, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, and my own father, Duke Aegir, the Prime Minister. One day, I will take his place as the prime minister of the Empire. I am more talented than anyone in my class — even Edelgard. I will lead the Empire to a bright, enlightened future.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I look forward to that.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That sounds like wishful thinking.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: There is nothing I cannot achieve.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Swimming through a sea of countless books, tracking down that single sought-after volume... It's absolute bliss. How do the poor fools who spend their days sharpening swords and polishing armor find any joy in life?

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Hey there, Professor! You here to check in on my training? Oh, that reminds me. I found this small cloth. It's kinda weird. Not really sure what it is, but it works great for wiping up sweat!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Wh-what is it? I'm not doing anything!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's not good to just do nothing.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: I'm not bothering anybody...am I?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Hey, what's this cake doing out here?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Cake?! Oh, come on... That's just cruel.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Oh, Professor... Hello. I was just looking for my— Well, it's...it's like a pale blue cloth. Have you seen it?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's search for it.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Eh? Um... OK...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'll tell Manuela.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Thank you so much.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Brigid has much more warmth than Fódlan. Even spring here has coolness! And you, Professor? Which do you find is worst? Too hot or too cold weather?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The cold.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I have agreeance! In Brigid, I am able to be wearing much lighter clothes.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The heat.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: But you are wearing many things, Professor. If you are not liking the heat, you should be wearing lighter clothes.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: It is better if you do not approach me. If you spend too much time around a man of Duscur, there will be rumors.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: For years, the boar prince and I were inseparable. I know him better than almost anyone else. So let me give you some advice. Beneath all that princely polish, he's an animal, nothing more. He's strong and skilled, sure. But don't place your trust in him as a human being. Take care he doesn't chew you up and spit you out.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: It's thanks to my adoptive father, Lonato, that a commoner like me is here at the academy. He is the very model of chivalry. Someday I'm going to be just like him.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Professor, you're the one taking out the bandits? Heh, that's one way to start your career at the academy. I didn't realize they'd order us to risk our lives here. Seems a bit extreme, doesn't it?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Our first assignment is to take out some bandits? Did anyone tell Lady Rhea that people's lives are at stake? I lost my own brother to bandits... ...Is something someone has said at some point, I'm sure. OK. Not my finest attempt at humor.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: The cathedral is nice and quiet. It's so relaxing... Oh, Professor. Did you come to pray to the goddess?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's right.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Me too! Shall we pray together?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I did not.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: No? But shall we pray together while you're here?

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: I've got to find out everyone's likes and dislikes so I know what to cook. Who knows when it will be my turn at kitchen duty! How about you, Professor? Do you like sweet or spicy food?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Sweet.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Ooh, same! I'll definitely remember that!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Spicy.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Spicy? Ooh, your tastes are so mature! I'll definitely remember that.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Felix, Sylvain and I have known each other since we were children. His Highness, as well. Though I should warn you that both Felix and Sylvain are a bit...challenging at times. The moment I take my eyes off them, they're off causing all kinds of trouble. It's always been that way.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Now that you're all the way over here, Professor, care to join me in some training? After training, I love tending to the horses or burying myself in a good pile of books. Ahh, there's truly nothing better!

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: It is the duty of every Fódlan noble to demonstrate piety toward Seiros. Have you also come to offer your prayers to the goddess, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Sure.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: You don't sound terribly sure. Perhaps you are not of noble birth? After all, devotion is not as essential for a commoner.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Not exactly.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: I see. The truth is, I am not a particularly devoted believer either. But it would be unbecoming for a noble like me to neglect his prayers, wouldn't it?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: The next assignment is to track down bandits? Sounds like some training is in order! Tell me something, Professor. When it comes to a one-on-one battle, which is better? Strength or skill?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Strength.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I knew it! When it's all said and done, muscle always comes out on top.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Skill.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: You might be right. But when it's all said and done, I still think muscle comes out on top!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I'm so glad to be a student here, if only because I get to use this library. Reading books from all the regions of Fódlan... I feel almost like I'm visiting those places myself.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You should visit them in person.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I'd like to. I don't have many chances to travel...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You can learn so much from books.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I agree! They're brimming with the knowledge and experience of our ancestors.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: There were way too many vegetables in today's meal. The ratio of vegetables to sweets was completely skewed... Oh! Hi, Professor! Were you just eavesdropping on me? Well...everyone knows a plateful of sweets is far preferred to a plateful of vegetables, regardless of age.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Um, Professor? Our next mission is to go after a group of bandits. I'm...not very confident. I'm afraid I'll just hold everyone else back. I should probably stay behind for this one. Or help plan the attack instead.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Uh. Hello. Um, if you'll excuse me...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I'm bored! Maybe I should go into town... But that would be such a hassle. Oh! Hi, Professor. I'm rather busy right now, so do make it quick.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You don't look busy to me.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Ah, you can tell? I suppose being a professor has taught you how to ferret out time wasters.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: If you're busy, never mind.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Are you sure? I thought you'd found me out for a moment there...

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Professor! Hey, do you know how old Captain Jeralt is?

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: That's enough, Leonie. If I don't know, how could my child know?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: It's not normal to forget your own age, you know. It's kind of worrisome, actually.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: By the time you're forgetting your own age, you're past the point of caring.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: I guess if you put it that way, you've got a point...

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Thank you for paying me a visit. Is there anything troubling you? Or is there, perhaps, something I can help you with.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I wonder if the students are taking to me...

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: You seem to be getting along well with the students. I would advise you to be confident in your abilities. The rest will fall into place in time.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: About the teachings of Seiros...

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Believers live their lives by her sacred wisdom. Please use the library's vast resources to learn more.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: I can often be found here, so if there is ever anything you need, please do not hesitate to pay me a visit.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Inside the cathedral, there is a chapel dedicated to the Four Saints. Do you know of them? Saint Indech, Saint Macuil, Saint Cichol, and...

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Saint Cethleann! Who is your favorite, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Now that you are a member of the church, be sure to familiarize yourself with our teachings and traditions.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Oh, Professor! How are you today? I'm just heading out for a mission. I'll be seeing you!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Good luck.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I don't need luck! This will be a piece of cake. I'll be back before you know it!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Be careful.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: What make you say that? Do you know something I don't? Are there supernatural elements at play? Ghosts?! Ah...oh, forget it. I'll be going now.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Have we met?

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: No. Sorry. Must be my imagination.

conversation.speaker: Jeritza
conversation.line: You look bored. Care to duel?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: A duel?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: To the death?

conversation.speaker: Jeritza
conversation.line: What? I just wanted to spar...

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Excellent work guiding the students in the mock battle. Taking command like that? Simply splendid. And bearing the unknown Crest's power? Yes! I'm talking about you. Your talents are incredible, and Lady Rhea's insight as to your potential is doubly so.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: You know, Professor, there are some things I'll just never understand. Like the other night, I went on a date with a dashing, handsome, strong, young knight. Oh, I'm a bit weak just remembering him. Anyway... Do you know what that no-good jerk said when we got back to my room? He said, "What a mess. I'm afraid to go in there!" Can you believe it?! You know who cares about keeping everything neat and tidy? Not me, that's who. "Afraid to go in there." Some knight he is!

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: Do you know about the cardinals? They are the ones who run the church. Their identities are a closely guarded secret...

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: That person sure does remind me of somebody, but I can't figure out who. Oh, do ya need me for something? Sorry, but I'm really busy right now.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: Hello there! Are you that new professor everyone's talking about? Name's Anna. I'm a merchant who slings wares all around Fódlan... and beyond! I come in here all the time, so I'm sure our paths will cross more. Hopefully much more!

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Are you settled in here at the monastery yet? Make sure to have a good look around! There's much to see! Like fish! You do know about the pond behind the dining hall, right? You can fish there! Give it a try!

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: We will accompany you on your assignment. We don't want anything to happen to our precious students. If any of you run into trouble, we'll step in and help out!

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: The Knights of Seiros are also known as the shining knights. We are the sword and shield of the divine Seiros. There are many orders of knights in the world, but we are the only one that has the honor of bearing the name Seiros. As a member of the church, you should probably study up on the history of Seiros and the knights.

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: I hear the Officers Academy of the monastery was founded about two centuries ago. The eastern region of Fódlan was being invaded by Almyra, and so the archbishop of the time took measures to prevent the border from being taken. In order to ensure Fódlan would be safe from potential threats, she deemed it necessary to raise a generation of excellence. That is how the establishment was founded, though its purpose has changed over the years.

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: Zanado, the Red Canyon, is a place of great significance to the Church of Seiros. Even members of the church are forbidden from entering without permission. To go trampling around in there, causing trouble... Those bandits truly are morally reprehensible.

conversation.speaker: Student
conversation.line: Brigid, Almyra, Duscur... Even people from far-off lands gather here at the academy. Word of advice, Professor. There are those who don't think kindly of such people.

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: So, we are taking children into battle, are we? I am not certain I will be able to sleep soundly after beholding something like that... I shall allow you to turn back the hands of time, but know this power is not infinite!

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: So this is the Red Canyon... A ruin of sorts by the look of it. Let's end this quickly. The thieves must have been driven back. Be careful, or the cornered mice might bite us.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: The Red Canyon... This is the first time I have ever been here. It's like walking through a ruin. Let's get this battle out of the way, Professor. The thieves must have already been driven back.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: So this is the Red Canyon? Doesn't look red to me... Anyway, let's get things started, Teach. Looks like the thieves have been driven back. That's what we last heard, so no surprise there.

intro.speaker: Kostas
intro.line: The knights chased us all the way here?!

intro.speaker: Thief
intro.line: Chief, let's get out of here! There's no way we can win against them!

intro.speaker: Kostas
intro.line: Shut your dumb mouth! Where would we go at this point? You can't be a thief if you fear death!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Professor...I hear there's a back road to the west. Why don't we split up and attack from both the west and the front? If we advance tactfully, we can attack our enemy from both sides. I leave the rest to you. Regardless, we must cross the bridge first.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Regrettable...but there was no other way.

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: Allow me to clean this up for you, Lady Edelgard.

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: These ruffians are no match for a noble like me!

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: I...I killed them. What have I done? The blood...

battle.speaker: Caspar
battle.line: Are all real battles this exciting? Come on, let's get on to the next one!

battle.speaker: Bernadetta
battle.line: I don't care if they're stealing! Can I go home?!

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: So, is making us experience a real battle part of the church's teachings?

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: People and beasts are as one. Calm your heart, and do not be worried about this killing.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Thank you for leading us, Professor. Though I suppose there was no way we could lose to a familiar foe. In any case, something about this canyon feels...inexplicably strange.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: According to our information, there is a back road to the west. Let's split up and approach from the west and the front. If we advance cleverly, we attack from both sides and gain the advantage. I'll leave the rest to you, Professor. But before all else, we'll need to cross the bridge.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: I know they are just thieves, but this never gets easier for me…

battle.speaker: Felix
battle.line: Finished already? I was hoping for more of a challenge.

battle.speaker: Ashe
battle.line: If I’d hesitated… that would’ve been me.

battle.speaker: Sylvain
battle.line: I had to do it. Don’t hate me, please.

battle.speaker: Ingrid
battle.line: I can’t relax here. We need to prepare for our next battle!

battle.speaker: Annette
battle.line: I did it! See? I’m a great fighter!

battle.speaker: Mercedes
battle.line: I hope the goddess blesses them to rest in peace…

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: Still whole and sound, I hope…

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: We have defeated the thieves. We'll follow the knights' instructions for what to do next. You led us well, Professor.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: I hear there's a back road to the west. How about we split up and attack from there and from the front? We may be able to corner the enemy by approaching from both sides. In any case, we need to cross the bridge first. I'll leave the details to you, Teach.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: We were taken by surprise last time, but... I guess this is what we can expect when battling thieves.

battle.speaker: Lorenz
battle.line: It is a noble's duty to guard the welfare of the people. Nothing personal

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: I was planning to just sit back and watch. But hey, I got one!

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: I'm sorry... I didn't have a choice.

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: This is my first real fight. I guess I'm pretty strong!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: A precious opportunity to test my own strength. I won't make waste of your deaths.

battle.speaker: Marianne
battle.line: Please forgive me, Goddess...and save their souls...

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: This is what I've trained for!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Those thieves ran out of luck when they entered this canyon. They never had a chance. Your leadership was amazing, Teach. Let's leave the rest of the work to the knights.

battle.speaker: Thief
battle.line: We stole this treasure! It's all ours! There's not way we're gonna give it up to some knights!

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Damn, they're coming from the west too! I can't stand these brats!

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Sending these brats instead of the knights means they've underestimated me! Big mistake!

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: I should have never listened to that idiot... What a mistake...

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Y-you're... It can't be! The mercenary from before? So what, now you're pals with the knights? I'll kill you and your pesky brats!

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Spoiled little noble! Just die like a good little rich kid!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Do you really think being born a commoner gives you the right to kill? Despicable.

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Spoiled little noble! Just die like a good little rich kid!

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: Unfortunately for you, I will not oblige. You will regret all that you have done.

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Spoiled little noble! Just die like a good little rich kid!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Being noble has nothing to do with who you are as a person or how hard your life is. Your logic is illogical!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I remember this being a peaceful place...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Since when has it been called the Red Canyon...

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Hmm... I wonder why it is that you recall this place.  You must be weak of heart. Each time I speak, it scares you so.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Although the battle is at an end, do not feel too at ease.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: You surprised me.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Although the battle's at an end, do not feel too at ease.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm not scared.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Do you think you can lie to me? It saddens me to know you wish to hide such things from me.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Well, anyhow... I am quite fascinated by this place. As far as I can tell, this is your first time here...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Still, it feels familiar.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: How very odd. I wonder if somehow, my memories have... Hmm.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Have you been here before, Sothis?

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Here? I daresay it would be impossible to have forgotten such as place as this.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: I must admit I am unsure. Beyond the name and this strange feeling of familiarity, I can't seem to remember anything about this place. And yet...a great depth of emotion is tied to that sense of familiarity. Like joy and sorrow. Pain and love. And all things in between... If I was somehow here before, I wonder what took place...

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Professor? I was wondering where you were... It's about time we headed back to the monastery.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Professor? We should return to the monastery soon. We're all ready for the journey.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Teach? What are you doing here? We should get back to the academy.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: It is time to depart. But know that time reveals all things. One day, I will remember that which I have lost... Oh, by the way. It seems you've earned my gratitude. The thieves who came here are no more.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why are you grateful?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why are you...

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: I am not sure myself, yet I am grateful all the same. In any case... You must become accustomed to my voice! If you fall down with shock each time I speak, that just won't do.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Oh... You think you're standing strong? Of course you are! It was a jest.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: On our way out, I had the chance to observe the Red Canyon... Did you notice anything, Professor?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What are you talking about?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Oh, I suppose it was only me, then.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I did.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Of course. I expected as much.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: The area was covered in ruins, each more curious than the last. They did not match the architectural style of any era or culture within the Empire. Or across all of Fódlan, for that matter. That can only mean one thing... The valley's civilization must have flourished and fallen in the distant past, long before the Empire was established. Who do you think lived there?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Our ancestors.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A culture long since perished.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Subterranean beings.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Heh, it's possible they weren't even human.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Hmm, perhaps their remnants still influence this world...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: We're finally back. I'll leave the report to Lady Rhea in your hands, Professor.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Huh... Edelgard.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Does the Black Eagle House have a mission to see to? Remember–on a real battlefield, one can never tell what's to come. You can never dismiss the possibility of a worst case scenario. Take care, Edelgard.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: There's no need to state the obvious, Dimitri. But tell me... Why the concern? Perhaps you doubt my abilities? If so, your lack of insight is disappointing.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: That's...not what I meant. If I've offended you, I hope you'll accept my apology.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Don't worry about it. Professor, we must hurry. Everyone's waiting on you.

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: I suppose I should be off too. Try not to let her get to you, Dimitri. I promise you, there's no need for concern.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Hmm...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why are you so worried?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I'll tell you all about it...some other time.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Puppy love?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Hahaha! Now, that's a lark. I had no idea you had a sense of humor, Professor. I'll tell you all about it...some other time.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hey, Teach. On the way back, you seemed transfixed by the canyon. Did something happen there?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It's nothing

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Nice try, but you can't get anything past me. You saw something...or felt something. I'm sure of it. But hey, if you don't want to share, that's fine by me. Everyone has their secrets.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Actually...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: It seemed familiar to you? Huh. Can't say the same. Maybe it's a memory from when you were a child. Or from a past life. Anyway, if you can't remember, I guess there isn't really much more to be said.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Although, I'll admit, there is something about that canyon that has me captivated as well. How did Zanado come to be called the Red Canyon? Nothing there...was actually red...
